I believe the error is occuring because you are building with one level of a
compiler but deploying with another.  I'm confused as to which level of AJDT you
have?  Do you have AJDT 1.1.12 or AJDT 1.2.0 ?  I suspect you have a recent AJDT
that includes AspectJ 1.5.0 (which is adding the weaverversion attribute) and
then deploying it with AspectJ 1.2.1 or something like that which doesn't
understand the attribute.  I also don't know what the trails example is?

if you are running a recent AJDT, I'd suggest downloading a recent AspectJ 1.5.0
and ensuring your examples/simple/build.xml points to it.

Sorry, forgot the URL, the Trails I mentioned is a Web framework based on
Tapestry (https://trails.dev.java.net/).

I guess you are correct, I compiled the app using Eclipse's Compiler (1.2.0?),
but when running the Ant script it used my local installation of AspectJ (1.2.1)

ECLIPSE AJDT:

Version: 1.1.12
Build id: 20040813151120
AspectJ version: 1.2.0

ASPECTJ:

"Version 1.2.1 released on Friday Nov 5, 2004"

Looks like this issue was resolved a long time ago by compiling with consistent
levels of the compiler. Since then we've done a lot of work on versioning of
attributes to ensure we do a much better job of reading in back-level versions.
